column4: This sounds as if yu do not have a desktop environment but your WM is up. Try to log in and select a different DE.
that will probably work... but how can i fix gnome-panel?
Re-install the the related packages. There are meta packages that will give you everything. Requires some patience during download and installation but it usually fixes it.
can you tell me which ones?  i did a purge on gnome-panel and then installed it again.  no dice.
I can't guide you through everything but if your lightdm comes up your previous session (before update) may be flawed. 1. Create a new user and see if that one has the same problems.
2. Check if your ~/.dmrc has a session entry that is valid.
so 'Unity' works.  but is it possible to fix gnome-fallback?
Would it be fair to ask what you have done, I gave you some advice and don't know what you've tried.
apologies.  i'm not sure what you mean by a 'valid session entry'
i haven't tried much.  Unity works.  It sounds like Gnome Classic (No Effects) works
I'm lost, you said it works for Unity. Did you install a new user?
Did you use a different profile in a new session.
no new user.  just works logging into Unity or Gnome Classic (no effects)
Teh odd thing is that .dmrc is (or has been) ignored by GNOME.
no worries i think he'll just use gnome classic (no effects)
Yeah, but exclude .3 on your router.
or just make a dhcp range above .100.  that's what *most* do from the factory it seems.
